alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:33AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflows will impact portions of northern Catoosa, northwestern Walker and Dade Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 631 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Charleston to Bridgeport, and moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, Lakeview, Indian Springs, Graysville, Cole City, Wildwood, Fairview, Stephensville, Boynton, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker and Cloudland Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
